body.p: Born in Westernville, New York. Attended the Hudson Academy and Union College. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1839. Served as an officer in the Corps of Engineers. Participated in an expedition to the Pacific coast in 1846 and became secretary of state of California under a temporary military government. In 1849, he helped frame the constitution of the state of California. Resigned his commission and entered the practice of law in California in 1854. Returned to the army on August 19, 1861 as a Major General. Commanded the Department of the Missouri in November 1861. Commanded the Department of the Mississippi. In July 1862, Halleck was called to Washington, D.C. by President Abraham Lincoln to sere as General in Chief of the United States Army, in which position he served until March 1864. Served as chief of staff of the United States Army from March 1864 until 1865. Commanded the Military Division of the James until August 1865. Served in San Francisco, California, from August 1865 until 1869.
